verses.verse: It happened in the month <WH2320> Nisan, <WH5212> in the twentieth <WH6242> year <WH8141> of Artaxerxes <WH783> the king, <WH4428> when wine <WH3196> was before <WH6440> him, <WH5375> that I took up the wine, <WH3196> and gave <WH5414> it to the king. <WH4428> Now I had not been sad <WH7451> before in his presence. <WH6440>

The king <WH4428> said <WH559> to me, <WH6440> "Why is your face sad, <WH7451> since you are not sick? <WH2470> This is nothing else but sorrow <WH7455> of heart. <WH3820>" Then I was very <WH3966> much <WH7235> afraid. <WH3372>

I said <WH559> to the king, <WH4428> "Let the king <WH4428> live <WH2421> forever! <WH5769> Why shouldn't <WH6440> my face be sad, <WH3415> when the city, <WH5892> the place <WH1004> of my fathers <WH1>' tombs, <WH6913> lies waste, <WH2720> and its gates <WH8179> have been consumed <WH398> with fire? <WH784>"
Then the king <WH4428> said <WH559> to me, <WH1245> "For what do you make request?" So I prayed <WH6419> to the God <WH430> of heaven. <WH8064>

I said <WH559> to the king, <WH4428> "If it pleases <WH2895> the king, <WH4428> and if your servant <WH5650> has found favor <WH3190> in your sight, <WH6440> that you would send <WH7971> me to Judah, <WH3063> to the city <WH5892> of my fathers <WH1>' tombs, <WH6913> that I may build it. <WH1129>"

The king <WH4428> said <WH559> to me <WH7694> (the queen was also sitting <WH3427> by him <WH681>), "For how long shall your journey <WH4109> be? <WH7725> And when will you return?" So it pleased <WH3190> the king <WH4428> to send <WH7971> me; <WH5414> and I set him a time. <WH2165>

Moreover I said <WH559> to the king, <WH4428> "If it pleases <WH2895> the king, <WH4428> let letters <WH107> be given <WH5414> me to the governors <WH6346> beyond <WH5676> the River, <WH5104> that they may let me pass through <WH5674> until I come <WH935> to Judah; <WH3063>

and a letter <WH107> to Asaph <WH623> the keeper <WH8104> of the king <WH4428>'s forest, <WH6508> that he may give <WH5414> me timber <WH6086> to make beams <WH7136> for the gates <WH8179> of the citadel <WH1002> by the temple, <WH1004> for the wall <WH2346> of the city, <WH5892> and for the house <WH1004> that I shall enter into. <WH935>" The king <WH4428> granted <WH5414> my requests, <WH2896> because of the good hand <WH3027> of my God on me. <WH430>

Then I came <WH935> to the governors <WH6346> beyond <WH5676> the River, <WH5104> and gave <WH5414> them the king <WH4428>'s letters. <WH107> Now the king <WH4428> had sent <WH7971> with me captains <WH8269> of the army <WH2428> and horsemen. <WH6571>

When Sanballat <WH5571> the Horonite, <WH2772> and Tobiah <WH2900> the servant, <WH5650> the Ammonite, <WH5984> heard <WH8085> of it, <WH3415> it grieved them exceedingly, <WH7451> because a man <WH120> had come <WH935> to seek <WH1245> the welfare <WH2896> of the children <WH1121> of Israel. <WH3478>
So I came <WH935> to Jerusalem, <WH3389> and was there three <WH7969> days. <WH3117>

I arose <WH6965> in the night, <WH3915> I and some <WH4592> few <WH4592> men <WH582> with me; <WH5046> neither told I any man <WH582> what my God <WH430> put <WH5414> into my heart <WH3820> to do <WH6213> for Jerusalem; <WH3389> neither was there any animal <WH929> with me, <WH929> except the animal that I rode on. <WH7392>

I went out <WH3318> by night <WH3915> by the valley <WH1516> gate, <WH8179> even toward <WH6440> the jackal <WH8577>'s well, <WH5869> and to the dung <WH830> gate, <WH8179> and viewed <WH7663> the walls <WH2346> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> which were broken down, <WH6555> and its gates <WH8179> were consumed <WH398> with fire. <WH784>
Then I went on <WH5674> to the spring <WH5869> gate <WH8179> and to the king <WH4428>'s pool: <WH1295> but there was no place <WH4725> for the animal <WH929> that was under me to pass. <WH5674>

Then went I up <WH5927> in the night <WH3915> by the brook, <WH5158> and viewed <WH7663> the wall; <WH2346> and I turned back, <WH7725> and entered <WH935> by the valley <WH1516> gate, <WH8179> and so returned. <WH7725>

The rulers <WH5461> didn't <WH3045> know where I went, <WH1980> or what I did; <WH6213> neither had I as yet <WH3651> told <WH5046> it to the Jews, <WH3064> nor to the priests, <WH3548> nor to the nobles, <WH2715> nor to the rulers, <WH5461> nor to the rest <WH3499> who did <WH6213> the work. <WH4399>

Then I said <WH559> to them, <WH7200> "You see the evil <WH7451> case that we are in, <WH3389> how Jerusalem lies waste, <WH2720> and its gates <WH8179> are burned <WH3341> with fire. <WH784> Come, <WH3212> let us build up <WH1129> the wall <WH2346> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> that we won't <WH2781> be disgraced."

I told <WH5046> them of the hand <WH3027> of my God <WH430> which was good <WH2896> on me, <WH4428> as also of the king's words <WH1697> that he had spoken <WH559> to me. <WH559> They said, "Let <WH6965>'s rise up and build. <WH1129>" So they strengthened <WH2388> their hands <WH3027> for the good work. <WH2896>

But when Sanballat <WH5571> the Horonite, <WH2772> and Tobiah <WH2900> the servant, <WH5650> the Ammonite, <WH5984> and Geshem <WH1654> the Arabian, <WH6163> heard <WH8085> it, <WH3932> they ridiculed us, <WH959> and despised us, <WH559> and said, "What is this thing <WH1697> that you are doing? <WH6213> Will you rebel <WH4775> against the king? <WH4428>"

Then answered <WH7725> I them, <WH559> and said to them, <WH430> "The God of heaven <WH8064> will prosper <WH6743> us. <WH5650> Therefore we, his servants, will arise <WH6965> and build; <WH1129> but you have no portion, <WH2506> nor right, <WH6666> nor memorial, <WH2146> in Jerusalem. <WH3389>"
